data.text: @BaileysShows For my family Oscar night is still a big night ! I was raised with great movies  although Mysteries was my Mum and Grandmums favorites . I agree escape for their generation were movies @BaileysShows

@BaileysShows My dad loved movies just not the biker films . I remember after myDad passed , my mum went to see” Last Detail” and she said “ Oh my, Joycie he said the F word so many times but he’s a very good actor lololo @BaileysShows

@sadieRHW One’s attitude towards film per se makes a big difference too. My grandparents would only watch movies 4 escapist entertainment.
In contrast, my Dad has taught me to appreciate all kinds of movies + introduced me to classic film. And he will even watch Hallmark movies with me! 😊

@sadieRHW So much depends on one’s circumstances, attitudes, etc. Maybe your dad didn’t want to see/ endorse “counter culture” nonsense or didn’t think the film had value? My dad saw it w/ friends + had my grandparents’ permission. But my grandparents would never have watched such a movie!

@BaileysShows Saw Easy Rider at a Drive In  when I was 18 and remember coming home and asking my Dad if he would go and see it. He said,”No, these are not films”we lost Dad in 79 and he never saw it ! @BaileysShows Wonder what he would say today🤔
